5E33625B19A74948BBBECD11790761AE.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

707908C344DE405DA47AB4419BDF0F23.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

0414AC8A4E334865884A2A5FB11C5140.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume and portfolio) following the work placement

86EE51B1580641EFA1E501699FCA7943.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

FF0F5BEB41214C948F939F3CAB290041.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship and partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry

E350AEFE1833424E9A55744CBC8139DD.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

67F59C2680084A33BC5EB69F047DD609.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

16655A6AB0134F229B3C735904D025AF.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets and reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

895379D8DB46451E8255ACF937495733.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

55F10E6CF3AA441CB43FE17FDE68CBF1.description: Participate in a work placement experience

04C1D2ADBAEC4CC9A1A62E45AE8DCA03.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

B9A9A1659AD44410871C38BBE7E6A3C4.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

3665EFFF247E4BEC8D97E4BB0F04F12C.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions

70BCB205A4B741D5959479EB12F8EB7B.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

457468815A654732885AC0C6C004CC32.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms)

C9AF242992C14F23B1A8A5DED90E63A5.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

0AD2806EB7D144DC9C18644A44C6842D.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

AC86173CFDFB4FAFA9A960527148FD0F.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

3C852112428448C0A4B497F3B2A7904B.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff and employer) involved in the work placement.

D82E3BE68C9E42D6B8DC8DD146C7D14D.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

5263E4B0CBDA47328EE5B8B69D063C15.description: Reflect on business and personal successes and challenges resulting from the operation of the start-up.

E4BB69FC08B34F56865F670F07F599AE.description: Implement processes for monitoring the operations and progress of the start-up to conclusion.

F1A83794B0A741248645B20B281FD39C.description: Launch and operate the start-up outlined in the business model canvas.

1183DAFA1B454144842991D17A9FF4AB.description: Discuss the importance of, and processes (e.g., regular reports, maintaining financial reports and collecting data) for, monitoring the operations and progress of the start-up.

ED7FC5D0D9F948B5B8511782350714AB.description: Execute, conclude and evaluate the success of a short-term startup.

DA4A6585715E497E85623F3508ED160B.description: Executing and Concluding a Start-up A (Optional)

EC64E39860014946B99CD04D05DA9A1E.description: Complete a business model canvas for a business idea or concept.

2246804739644E8AB95446504BE76BE2.description: Identify and describe the elements of the business model canvas, including: Value proposition – what the unique business idea is and what it promises to deliver; Customer segments – groups of people or companies to whom the business will target its product or service; Key activities – processes and tasks that need to be completed in order to serve customers; Key resources – resources (e.g., human, tools and financial) required and the source of those resources; Channels – how the business will be marketed to gain and serve customers; Customer relationships – a description of the type of relationship the business will have with customers and how the business will interact with them; Key partners – the external companies or suppliers that will help the business carry out its activities; Cost structure – all anticipated costs for establishing and operating the business; and, Revenue streams – how the business will make money.

69DBF83438DA4BA6B800310508BE9154.description: Research what the business model canvas is and how it can be used to outline a business concept.

6B69E132682243E8BFC4D25A95027755.description: Develop a list of questions that should be answered when planning a startup, such as: What is the business idea?, What need or want does it fill, or what problem does it solve?, Who are the targeted customers?, How much money and other resources will be required for start-up?, How will money and other resources be obtained?, What other resources are needed?.

7E10ECD35780474290EB6988184A0CF4.description: Discuss the importance of planning before launching a start-up

555AA4457D14442799017A2FE538464B.description: Outline a business idea or concept using the business model canvas planning framework.

29B82DAFC5A64B55BD77AA075FFA6996.description: Reflect on ways that an employer/management can support a healthy and safe work environment, such as: leading by example; establishing, and training employees on, procedures for identifying hazards and mitigating associated risks; holding supervisors and workers accountable; and, setting reasonable health and safety goals and objectives.

A9497FD7354C4F2DBC61B8C7E8D69FF6.description: Investigate employers’ and employees’ rights and responsibilities as they pertain to health and safety in the workplace in Saskatchewan.

CEF67965FBC244C886328035ACCFB96A.description: Role-play situations where employees, supervisors and managers effectively deal with health and safety concerns within the workplace.

A6E474664B994758925A80821AC3CC35.description: Research: the meaning of due diligence and an employer’s responsibility to protect the health and safety of all workers; the legal requirements for health and safety programs in the workplace outlined in provincial legislation (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Regulations); the legal requirement for, and purpose of, an occupational health and safety (OHS) committee within the workplace; and the financial penalties for failing to comply with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulations

D3E5A3A8DE264F1FAEFDE953EA00CCB0.description: Discuss reasons (e.g., protecting the health and safety of employees, creating a positive work environment and the costs [e.g., to the injured worker and to the business] associated with a workplace injury or incident) for having a safety plan within a business.

ADD9FC995A3243FFB623BDDA8E11E49E.description: Identify the benefits to employers and employees of the Saskatchewan Workers Compensation Act and the Meredith Principles.

F3ED2B7E68664B438218685E8D9CC943.description: Describe the general duties of self-employed persons as outlined in the Saskatchewan Employment Act.

3298660A529E46519A5829F95FE04A8D.description: Assess the importance of an occupational health and safety plan within a business.

CEB6159723D2451C8499C352982A44B2.description: Identify credible sources of mental health support for Saskatchewan and Canadian entrepreneurs.

91660B217DD94E72A107E3CD89653B56.description: Explore the impact of mentoring relationships on mental health and wellbeing.

6BCB17D3E26D46BDA4CE67B2E2631666.description: Suggest strategies (e.g., practising self-care and surrounding oneself with positive influences) for addressing and maintaining positive mental health as an entrepreneur.

19F25175EC1746FE9EBEC1CC2BF0B38E.description: Investigate barriers (e.g., cost and stigma) faced by entrepreneurs in seeking mental health services and support.

8ABCE6F53D944D83952C4888633654F4.description: Analyze differences in the mental health and well-being challenges faced by various groups of entrepreneurs such as women, newcomers, younger entrepreneurs and individuals who are gender and/or sexually diverse.

1E4DE771BF79498DB6FBF1681AA46326.description: Research statistics related to the mental health and well-being of Canadian entrepreneurs

FB01E06E2A1D4C319142EC12B3563D4A.description: Identify stressors (e.g., income uncertainty, loneliness and isolation) faced by many entrepreneurs and the resulting impact on self, the business, society and others such as family and friends

5D53FEBB15324354BD55C718EA31F4A6.description: Analyze the relationship between an entrepreneur’s personal mental health and well-being and the health of their business.

F1E1667B688E4E9EBAA49CCF93E16984.description: Discuss the concept of life/work balance as it relates to entrepreneurs.

37381753BF11435FBBDA73EBAAF95D2B.description: Assess the importance of positive mental health and well-being for Saskatchewan and Canadian entrepreneurs.

1F4CF24C4E6C407F83FAEA0D8D2E2C2B.description: Explore ways (e.g., using software such as spreadsheets or accounting packages and paper copy) for recording and managing cash flow.

40CFAF3DAF614CA987D0DFCD52C3BCC5.description: Discuss the financial implications of a positive and a negative cash flow.

2C5B81E988FE427383C92BEA0B1E4EAE.description: Differentiate between a positive and a negative cash flow

7517E665FF7D4E27B54ED980611CC770.description: Analyze what cash flow is, its importance to the day-to-day operations of a business and how it is commonly reported (i.e., statement of cash flow and cash flow projection).

C9E30B3EE668414592FE4F9420F241AD.description: Calculate the break-even point for a variety of business scenarios.

12DA1A2AD43F4587BC77A9867080193B.description: Discuss when (e.g., at start-up or when considering an expansion) a business might conduct a break-even analysis.

BC0CA1C7789B433F9678172EBAB9F740.description: Examine the components of a break-even analysis

DD57704F17DF471BAB971B7C3187A58E.description: Differentiate between start-up and ongoing costs.

C5547FAB8BF7449D9379DB22D081EA63.description: Explore sources (e.g., personal investment, love money, share capital, angel investors, grants, subsidies and bank loans) for funding a business start-up

4DD796DD49FC4C2FA735B2049086EF50.description: Debate the opinion that financial success equals business success.

2BC85BED51964A2B910F9B97349BD13E.description: Discuss the importance of maintaining accurate and up-to-date financial records throughout the life of a business.

A9FE9D4765AE4447B08EEC9ACB1AE4D0.description: Explore financial considerations for a business start-up.

74A956499EF843C9A4D7C35CEE87DE58.description: Financial Records, Planning and Management A (Core)

CD7FCB69D3EF48CFA88C48F27395D297.description: Prepare SWOT analyses for a variety of entrepreneurship scenarios.

93CC73FB06D744FFAB227A40AC46526F.description: Examine the components and purpose of a SWOT (i.e., Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats) analysis as a tool for market research.

1ABD15E20F814317BE2AEE07C6D74A8E.description: Research the availability and use of online (e.g., social media and website) analytics for market research.

780D8357DEDB4A4891F8F36A7F6AE99C.description: Analyze various scenarios requiring market research to determine when and how one or more methods for collecting data would be effective.

B0213769D1B4490E92020D8F396827FE.description: Compare methods for collecting market research data, such as: test marketing; surveys (e.g., digital or paper); observation; and, focus groups.

5EB3A5A75D1A4B3DB5BA343744A6725C.description: Explore what a trend and industry analyses are and their roles in supporting market research.

1FE70A52DF8B4F0E9B1427BD711386C4.description: Identify circumstances (e.g., launching a new business, expanding into a new market or looking for customers) when market research would be beneficial.

742226D1D7D24C93ABE4021D3E73FF36.description: Discuss reasons (e.g., making informed decisions and avoiding costly mistakes) for conducting market research.

615E26027D484B5DB6A420E24030CEA8.description: Examine the role of market research in effective business planning.

72A4993E8A924C20AA79A74C0059AE45.description: Describe the four Ps in action for a business, organization or brand/product of personal interest.

D8BB1CBAAA3341D29F191A62E517CCCC.description: Identify ways in which businesses promote their products online and through other mediums using strategies such as coupons, contests, loyalty cards, samples and special events.

A7A830D591F1469EB6CDC5CE543DB965.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of direct selling for both buyer and seller.

88D07535979C4E25B2375C8AC6A2733E.description: Evaluate the impact of technology and e-commerce on a business’ ability to reach potential consumers directly

2B2CC887C1984E39BCD5A919122829AE.description: Differentiate between direct (i.e., seller to consumer) and indirect (i.e., seller to a third party such as an importer, wholesaler or retailer) channels for selling and distributing products and services

74A3C05955FC4EF0A1614B5E1727C35C.description: Research factors (e.g., input costs, profit, competitive pricing and price sensitivity) that should be considered when pricing a product in the marketplace.

ED280F0632B84462AAF22A068504DD2D.description: Analyze characteristics (e.g., quality, design, features and benefits) considered important for a good product.

4FA085463F394C7BBD318C10C471C179.description: Differentiate between products that are tangible (e.g., goods) and intangible (e.g., services, ideas or experiences).

60F69FC297A9439AAD81CFE33450F001.description: Identify the four Ps of marketing (i.e., product, price, place and promotion) known as the Marketing Mix.

67D688FEF431493DB330C2CDBB8B8ABE.description: Examine the interrelatedness of the four Ps of marketing.

8D21B3B6588D47F78A1CEF53EB7789D3.description: Identify the unique selling propositions presented by several local or other businesses or brands.

DE1A7895441E411788DEDD03A0C28A6D.description: Explain the value of a unique selling proposition.

82F6C06D2BB843F592DBBA3B31DA10C7.description: Categorize types of customer information (e.g., demographics [e.g., age, gender, income, ethnicity and culture] and psychographic [e.g., attitudes, values and lifestyle]) that is useful to gather and analyze.

49597F39FE1C44DBAAC77DC50F3692F2.description: Examine the importance of knowing one’s customers and target market

49C20B55EE56482084F22368BBB57CEA.description: Propose strategies (e.g., posing as a customer, visiting the competitor’s website and reviewing advertisements) for gathering competitive intelligence.

C6794AD4B2004E12A786BB73C3C51A8D.description: Summarize the types of competitor information (e.g., pricing, marketing strategies and market share) that is useful to collect and analyze.

3869BF93ACB8467292DA4D2C7B243FA1.description: Differentiate between direct and indirect competitors.

554F491088F64CC8BCB4F4CFEB2B0B76.description: Assess the importance of identifying competitors in the marketplace.

060B49308C6B4CB89F2DD24ECDC446D5.description: Discuss the purposes of marketing (e.g., selling what a business offers and managing a brand)

791481E7744D4F61B9B03D74D1135B79.description: Investigate the brand image presented by successful companies.

FB10F3A8AAFD469BB926FEB9DC911EEA.description: Identify examples of brand names, logos or trademarks, and slogans that contribute to brand identity for a variety of businesses.

9E7EDBF650D9432EB30D70B8ACCD94D0.description: Differentiate between brand identity and brand image.

ECC947BA67094956A4B8549A150D05CA.description: Analyze marketing strategies for managing a brand.

BFD06E4BEC9941D38B458DEB7C560DF8.description: Develop a social responsibility plan for an existing, proposed or fictitious business.

2EA47996FB084DC0A1A50D05831CD9CF.description: Compare the social responsibility efforts of at least two businesses in the same industry.

AAED657B9F144E2CA939218910DE6A87.description: Debate the opinion that economic responsibility is the most important component of social responsibility.

F59306DB824D44C79D9BB7C9DED77740.description: Examine the relationship among economic responsibility and the other components of social responsibility.

17F22A6BF49646A4A6844E7DD9D7DDB1.description: Discuss ways (e.g., sponsoring a local non-profit annual fundraiser and donating a percentage of earnings to a worthy cause) that an entrepreneur can be philanthropic.

D55495A52A36452883F5DF0DD3773BB3.description: List examples (e.g., using fair business practises, ethically sourcing materials and offering competitive wages to employees) of ethical business practices.

05A919BACE174D34BDA0FF03EAB98F1B.description: Describe what ethics are, and how personal and societal ethics influence business ethics

3D353E94DBFA4247BDED36AC58347EA9.description: Identify ways (e.g., using alternative energy sources and implementing a recycling program) that businesses can demonstrate environmental responsibility.

24A29382F63943129766D39E116485B3.description: Research social responsibility according to the guiding principles of wâhkôhtowin, wicihitowin and wîtaskêwin.

2672A74093F144F7B686FF7E0D273DE4.description: Discuss potential benefits (e.g., stronger brand image and reputation, increased customer loyalty and empowering employees to do good) associated with social responsibility.

BF9D6A04FBD249D285833915DFF3F4D8.description: List the four components (i.e., environmental, ethical, philanthropic and economic) of social responsibility.

7EC5F63D6FB24A248E5FD25D63DF186B.description: Assess the importance of social responsibility in entrepreneurship.

E3D3ED86650C4DB7A97130B4149322FA.description: Identify additional types of insurance coverage (e.g., general and professional liability) available to businesses.

713B2112555547D2A857D4AA97C19707.description: Differentiate between mandatory and optional Workers’ Compensation coverage in Saskatchewan and Canada.

42442B12D3B14D99B129B3C6B78364DF.description: Assess Saskatchewan employment standards (e.g., employing young workers, minimum wage, overtime and vacation leave) applicable to entrepreneurs who hire employees or use the services of a subcontractor

871C77A491E94933BB0BE1F32F59E594.description: Summarize the process for opening applicable tax accounts (e.g., Provincial Sales Tax [PST], and Goods and Services Tax [GST]), collecting tax and remitting payments.

1DE18186930749CBA0F43225FE25848A.description: Research requirements for collecting and remitting taxes (e.g., Provincial Sales Tax [PST], Goods and Service [GST] and business income) in Saskatchewan and Canada.

35E0032D9E5346058021160282EE7FE2.description: Investigate the process for registering a business name (e.g., with Information Services Corporation) in Saskatchewan.

B1992FE23BA4425689E477B4D907B72C.description: Research the business licenses and permits typically required at the federal, provincial, municipal and band (e.g., Band Council Resolution or BCR) levels, and the processes for applying for and obtaining them.

04D9E4CE86A2402BB32CBE81BB7E7A04.description: Analyze the logistics associated with establishing a business in Saskatchewan.

D3B9F7336730497D952E81532BD8D5E6.description: Create scenarios best suited for each type of business structure and justify each choice

A94A688500024483929160ABAB13BE92.description: Identify sources of advice and information (e.g., legal, accounting, Chief and Council and other entrepreneurs) related to business structures.

F4D1967C8E354CCEB173BA69CAD39E4F.description: Research external factors (e.g., requirements for eligibility to access funding or support from a specific program, and tax and other laws such as the Indian Act) which may impact decisions related to business structures

BB5A8A7727AC4E5D909685E0B08E7B49.description: Discuss how attitudes and beliefs (e.g., community and collective wellbeing) shaped by worldviews inform decisions related to business ownership and structures,

251240CB330640ADA799D0D0540E52B4.description: Summarize the advantages and disadvantages of each type of business structure.

9058C560C38E47FF9B2A40B50322F184.description: Examine the purpose and benefits of succession planning and the impact each type of business structure has on the process.

5FE945EE116C4777B289E813AF838DA2.description: Compare the features (e.g., ownership, process for establishing, profitsharing, liability protection and longevity) of various types of business structures.

4E06CADA130049A199534E5D4057B7B8.description: Identify examples of each type of business structure within the local community and province.

FCF4504A3B4D4385B23C2617130FC30B.description: List the common types of business structures including: sole proprietorship; partnership; corporation, including private, public and crown; co-operative; and, franchise.

059CC3455783406AB766DCA415C23F28.description: Evaluate common types of business structures.

2DB67A3D0DBA4EBFADDCB2519EB21A46.description: Describe the processes for accessing financial support available to Saskatchewan and Canadian entrepreneurs.

7109EA3DE98249B68669381FEF646D39.description: Research the availability of financial support (e.g., grants and loans) for Saskatchewan entrepreneurs including First Nations and Métis people, newcomers, women and youth.

FA59B54FCFD24F709F628ECC1355B103.description: Identify incentives or initiatives for new and expanding business development available within the local community.

B7C8D788A2914792AAA01EEECE08A9D6.description: Investigate how business ventures evolve and change over time and how the need for, and kinds of, supports also evolve and change.

A76B01DA38C645789E7254C1C0951061.description: Examine the relationship between local entrepreneurial success and the growth and sustainability of communities in Saskatchewan.

C0C914C4B9144585B26EC61889FA1764.description: Research the structure, mission and goals of various community development agencies, business associations and agencies (e.g., local and provincial chambers of commerce, Clarence Campeau Development Fund, SK Start-up Institute, Women Entrepreneurs of Saskatchewan, Community Futures Saskatchewan, SaskMétis Economic Development Corporation and Tools and Finance for Aboriginal Business) that support Saskatchewan entrepreneurs.

DB33643301AE46D3A67DACCE2F317E7B.description: Discuss the value of mentorship in entrepreneurship for both mentors and mentees.

3394ECD569664D80887B2A40266757A4.description: Construct a plan to develop or grow personal networking skills.

25FC5AB72A0F455798EBA8DB829B2FFE.description: Reflect on personal comfort level with networking.

284675FBE394455CB99C238EBBA5E953.description: Propose networking strategies for individuals who are uncomfortable with, or afraid of, the process.

277BD971BBA74982826580FDCB2E11A9.description: Examine the mutual benefits of contributing to, and receiving support from, a network.

997DEF8BF7D542C9A6E96A293FBA75D2.description: Describe ways (e.g., volunteering, job shadows, attending business trade fairs or business functions and informational interviews) to build and expand personal and professional networks within the local business community.

5BE6F0A355FE42C49516BBD6774A6F54.description: Identify potential allies (e.g., family, friends, Elders, tribal councils, postsecondary and training institutions) that could be a part of personal and professional networks to support the development of a new venture within the community.

C0E85D02B7CC45EFA851422D8104717B.description: Describe networking and its importance for entrepreneurial success.

F9A0D56C4D8645109F222C187A606962.description: Explore community initiatives, government and community development agencies, and business associations that support entrepreneurship.

8BCA046ED056434CAFB687DB340225A8.description: Apply the design thinking process to find solutions to real-life or given entrepreneurial scenarios.

7B751179B06F4E7385C96B723F60A3BA.description: Establish norms (e.g., defer all judgment, aim for quantity, build on others’ ideas and involve everyone) for group brainstorming.

F64E02FE1E4046DDADF5115C7680F2E8.description: Research effective brainstorming techniques (e.g., green light thinking, mind maps, rapid ideation, game storming and step-ladder technique).

B7B9FCAFEC6C4AD8A4D188C09710D1CC.description: Analyze the role and importance of failure as part of the design thinking process.

FFC14A4D258D42D2951341CF753019D6.description: Explain the non-linear and iterative nature of the design thinking process.

6EE6EA29B14A42F390B238530B0AB4A3.description: Describe processes and actions that are commonly taken during each stage of the design thinking process, such as: observing consumers to understand the human need (empathize); analyzing observations from the empathize stage to understand and define the problem to be solved (define); brainstorming solutions for the problem (ideate); creating an early sample or model of the solution (prototype); and, observing how customers interact with the prototype and collecting consumer feedback (test).

F9083BA1F9884843A95E6EEFF26BDBDE.description: Identify the five stages of design thinking (i.e., empathize, define, ideate, prototype and test).

0A496C80495848DBA8E59311235DDD49.description: Investigate how successful companies such as Netflix, Nike and Airbnb have incorporated design thinking into their business strategies.

794BA9CC28A342A79DBF607C8962AD13.description: Research proposed benefits (e.g., increased efficiency and return on investment, increased opportunities for collaboration and reduced risk associated with launching new ideas) associated with using the design thinking process in business.

32E32425194046CDB9FE595F2A970CB1.description: Describe design thinking, including its human-centric nature.

7D46768490CF45F6B8688494B7A92C19.description: Assess design thinking as a process for creating successful and meaningful entrepreneurial solutions.

8F0D2159984946559B76807FE2F2BC8B.description: Identify potential entrepreneurial opportunities at home, at school and in the community.

4DE2BFA5D9F840AF91FD7A0E68E4EBDF.description: Differentiate between an opportunity (i.e., the problem) and an idea (i.e., a potential solution).

4F9079D145DF4253878AA4F3BEEA131F.description: Propose ways (e.g., being optimistic, accepting challenges, searching for opportunities and researching) that entrepreneurs discover and take advantage of opportunities

F642894703E541428F6AC03D04F098B0.description: Differentiate between a trend and a fad and their impacts on entrepreneurial opportunities.

08E1CD7CB91748F8A457B754FA6FA549.description: Assess the impact of PESTLE factors (i.e., political, economic, social, technological, legal and environmental) on entrepreneurial opportunities

C282ACB985A64F64972246DA8EDC7C35.description: List potential sources of entrepreneurial opportunities (e.g., technological change, changing demographics, shortages, surpluses and shifts in demand).

2C83BABC8C5245D9AF06F033E2C26AD2.description: Discuss the view that change causes entrepreneurial opportunities and that entrepreneurial opportunities cause change.

E6610434B7B54AB9A9AA6500DBC5A147.description: Describe an entrepreneurial opportunity (i.e., a need, a want or a problem that needs to be solved).

0F0AF2AAFC69487E9D61DE06211D26E0.description: Examine entrepreneurial opportunities at home, at school and in the community.

70147361EE574ABBBEB0BB7412B9DD56.description: Recognize and affirm the characteristics and skills possessed by classmates.

B4DD9D49A3FA4110A16F640B20D02CD6.description: Commit to a personal plan for utilizing personal characteristics and skills and for overcoming shortcomings necessary for entrepreneurial success.

1FD5320A9ED446CA90402AAAFE1EA631.description: Propose ways (e.g., using a team approach, formal and informal education and volunteering) to overcome personal shortcomings necessary for entrepreneurial success.

CB141B52E17845C49C136324DFF1B70F.description: Reflect on personal characteristics, skills, interest in, and suitability for, entrepreneurship as a career pathway of choice or for intrapreneurship within a company or organization

85983727FA99419496595521EFB78A4C.description: Identify traits (e.g., self-doubt, perfectionism and being easily distracted) that may hinder entrepreneurial success.

69195A733CD542FDAC545AAAE1DF8648.description: Describe interpersonal skills (e.g., verbal and non-verbal communication, listening, negotiation, decision-making and assertiveness) that contribute to entrepreneurial success.

9B445D88CA5544FF8FEBA60282918954.description: Examine the role of creativity in entrepreneurship.

8FFB1F579FFA4D6E8FE74AB87AC914E9.description: Discuss what it means to have an entrepreneurial mindset.

42C5CC856C164AE098B155B96CB73179.description: Examine the relationship among personal financial competence and confidence, personal credit score and entrepreneurial progress and success.

1A5E3E7542674EC7AAF872C6A52A687C.description: Differentiate between characteristics that are innate and those that are learned and gained through time and experience.

8EE156D697854156886C9707B1D8C26C.description: Research characteristics (e.g., confidence, passion and motivation) and skills (e.g., leadership, teamwork and networking) common to successful entrepreneurs

33A20F0C9201441F89A9C49481CB3711.description: Assess characteristics and skills important for entrepreneurial success.

DA326BDE4E534319862EF122B7F6B95E.description: Communicate interview or research findings related to local and Saskatchewan entrepreneurs through a multi-media (e.g., video and presentation), print (e.g., brochure and magazine) or oral presentation.

F34D0F47737C4DC1BA4C48BECFC91AEB.description: Interview or research local and Saskatchewan entrepreneurs to gain insight into the broad range of entrepreneurial ventures within the community and province

D5399EE05D6B45A0BAD1C87E1CED1AF2.description: Generate a list of questions that could be asked of entrepreneurs to gain insight into their ventures and to understand what success means to them. Sample questions include: How did you come up with your business idea?, What problem does your business solve?, What makes your business unique?, Why did you choose entrepreneurship?, What is the biggest challenge you have overcome?, What is your greatest achievement?, What mistakes have you made in your business, and how did you handle them?, Do you consider yourself successful as an entrepreneur? Why or why not?, As an entrepreneur, what advice would you give your younger self?

361B1A1A152246079DF544AEE6BDE17A.description: Debate the role of failure in entrepreneurship.

DB07BE8E68314F208C9DF5AE6B8EB7FB.description: Assess entrepreneurial success as defined by the Seventh Generation Principle.

B85F08E8127541DF9A996B623B420D25.description: Examine how culture and worldviews, including those of First Nations and Métis people in Saskatchewan, inform the definition of success for an entrepreneurial venture.

B95184970F0F49709B1BDD64EF41A158.description: Discuss the meaning of success within the contexts of profit, not-for-profit and social enterprises.

39108E0BF7714837B5870C02DB18B8EC.description: Differentiate among for-profit, not-for-profit and social enterprises within the community and province.

B2A6EB803C684ACCBDFDD1F1C5CF6D02.description: Investigate factors that define and contribute to entrepreneurial success.

ABFEC52D4B564C65AED0A4629E58C4E6.description: Analyze statistics related to the contributions made by entrepreneurs to the local, provincial and Canadian economics.

69FF2CC4DBC74E8FBFC74BBFD47E46A2.description: Discuss the contributions that entrepreneurs make to Canadian society, such as: increasing productivity; creating jobs and more opportunities for people; raising the standard of living; and, inspiring and enhancing opportunities for under-represented or minority groups (e.g., persons with disabilities, women, youth, newcomers, elderly and individuals who are gender and/or sexually diverse.)

B0BBF6D0F96A430BAE3BDFED17F591AE.description: Discuss opportunities and challenges associated with being intrapreneurial and entrepreneurial within the school and community.

6854B8DF214D44A2AFE78138ACA524BB.description: Differentiate between: • an invention and an innovation; entrepreneurship and intrapreneurship; entrepreneurship and social entrepreneurship; and, social entrepreneurship and being socially responsible as an entrepreneur

A83BC2D6475042A78FAB24F1CE0B67C8.description: Identify examples of entrepreneurship and entrepreneurs within the local community and province.

D5F3EFF02F4A4180A58057E7286A1197.description: Compare the characteristics of a variety of entrepreneurial ventures/organizations, such as: for-profit, not-for-profit and social enterprise; franchise and independently owned; service production and goods production; local, provincial, national and international; and, home-based, online, brick and mortar, and bricks and clicks.

B319CEF24F274A0FAA62530FCB452282.description: Describe what entrepreneurship is and what entrepreneurs do.

0619A0B004664D8C8C4879214610BC1A.description: Analyze the role and contributions of entrepreneurship and intrapreneurship to personal, school and community life.
